lines.text: Now, if you'd made it Irish whiskey...
We'll get along famously.
Desolate place, isn't it?
If God had wanted to give the world an enema, he'd have stuck the nozzle in here.
What's your opinion of priests?
Well, what would you think of a man who wears skirts or a celibate who wants to be called "Father"?
The woman who cannot speak... cannot complain!
That was one hell of a mass, Father!
I have a small confession to make. All is not quite what it seems.
Why in hell can't I learn to mind my own business?
Just what the hell kind of game do you think you're playing?
She goes with us.
Over my dead body she does.

[points gun at Van Horne]
Oh, that can be arranged.
Holy Saint Patrick!
I would suggest that you not be here when he wakes up.
Where would you suggest I go?
To Hell.

[Looking out at an execution by firing squad]
A bullring. What a terrible place to die.
Well, you've got a choice. Firing squad or your Irish friend. How would you like to die?
From natural causes, naturally.

[laughing]
It's... it's the resurrection, and I didn't even wait three days!
It's not often I have such distinguished guests- men straight from the gates of Hell.
Life is full of constant surprises!
Come on, fat man!
My size is due to a glandular condition, Mr. Keogh, and is a subject on which I harbor absolutely no sensitivity.
I don't wish any of you to risk your lives. Instead, I ask each of you to go to your homes and pray for me. That I may be brave and resolute in bringing to Tomas de la Plata the wrath of God.
What do you say to a drink?
I never touch the rotten stuff except when I'm alone or with people.
Of course.
One missing. One drunk. Swell.
You were going to have a very lonely walk, priest.
You're here. That's all that matters.
I thought suicide was a mortal sin.
What does he want?
He wants you, Father. Just you.
Somebody get my bag. It's in the car.
Where are you going?
To kill Tomas de la Plata.
We three faced the firing squad together. Everything else is just borrowed time.
God protects fools and drunks, not idiots.
God works in mysterious ways.

[laughing and wheezing]
They think they'll make a hero out of me.
Which way is north?
That way, Senor.
Mexico, here I come.
[Thinking]
All my life I could have played it safe. Think of all the fun I would have missed.
Emmet?
For heaven's sake, woman. Don't speak now!

[laughing]
Well, I'll be goddamned.
What is it, Father?
It's... a gospel... according to Van Horne.
